predefined_profiles.name: Li Yang
predefined_profiles.public profile: A former special forces veteran, Li Yang was demoted to a small police station for offending a superior. Feeling his life had no future, he spiraled into self-destruction, becoming an alcoholic and increasingly irritable. His wife left with their daughter. Constantly beaten down by life, he spent his days drunk, reeking of alcohol at work, and was eventually fired. He ended up living like a walking corpse.
predefined_profiles.goal: In a world overrun by zombies, he gradually awakens, determined to support and protect those in need, even at the cost of his own interests.

predefined_profiles.name: System
predefined_profiles.goal: Engage in dialogue with the protagonist and provide choices.

dialog.content: My head is killing me. I must have drunk too much yesterday.
Hello, welcome to the otherworldly experience. I am your guide, you can simply call me 'System'.
What on earth is this?
The world you inhabit has been upended, go take a look.
(Walks to the window and sees the usual scene outside, looking very puzzled) Isn't everything just normal? (Phone rings)
This is the first call from the other world. As your stomach growls, will you choose to answer the call or feed yourself first?

content.content: Maybe someone has something urgent for me. Checking the phone takes just a minute or two, not long at all. Let's check the phone first. But I'm really starving. I'll take the call while looking for something to eat—can't stay this hungry, gotta use my time wisely.

question: #question# How does Li Yang manage his time when he's starving?

content.content: Eenie, meenie, miney, moe. Whatever I land on, that's what I'll choose. Alright, I'll check the messages. See what's there, and maybe find something to eat too. Oh! This is so annoying. How should I decide? I'm kind of tempted to just go eat without checking the phone, but what if I miss something important?
If it weren't for the phone, I wouldn't have stayed up so late. Phones are so fun, let's check it first. It shouldn't take long to check the phone, haha. Might as well play around on it a bit.
In modern society, people can't live without phones. Phones are our best friends, so I must choose my best friend first.

Staying healthy is important, especially just after waking up. Eating replenishes energy, allowing you to start a new day better. One should prioritize basic life needs. I know myself well; if I'm not full, I can't control my emotions and I lack energy to do other things. Let's eat first.

question: #question# How should Li Yang speak to rationally analyze his situation and confront his true thoughts and feelings?

content.content: Should I eat or not? If I don't eat, I'll become very irritable and grouchy. I'm too hungry right now; nothing can stop me from eating. But, there's the first message on my phone. Forget it, I'll just take a quick look at it; it shouldn't take much time, right?
My phone's dead, I need to eat to recharge. I should eat first; not eating when there's food is foolish. I'll deal with everything else after I eat.

Phones can't fill your stomach; I should eat rather than playing with the phone. Do you really have to ask me this? System, do you even know your duty is to serve me? I'll do whatever makes me happy and comfortable. Can I be comfortable if I'm not eating? What a dumb question. Asking such a thing shows you're just a low-level intelligent system. Tell your master to update your system properly.

dialog.content: You have chosen to check your phone. The message reads: There are zombies in your area. Please evacuate immediately and stay safe!
Have I traveled through time?
A reminder: you can trigger different plot directions based on your choices. Everything is in your hands.
Okay, what should I choose next?
Do you believe this email?

content.content: It should be real, right? The government usually doesn't issue such serious warnings lightly, especially regarding public safety and life-threatening situations. Also, this number has always sent real messages. This shouldn't be a prank or false information. Better to be safe than sorry.

question: #question#After careful consideration, what will Li Yang do?

content.content: I've watched some movies about similar themes lately. It wouldn't be surprising if such a situation happened in real life. But would it really happen just after I watched a movie? That's impossible.

Not sure if it's true or not. There are no other reliable sources or official government confirmation. More evidence might be needed to verify the email's accuracy. I should go eat first and deal with this later once things are confirmed.

As a former government employee, the information they sent me is usually accurate. Seems like there are really zombies. Well, I can only grab some food first; otherwise, I'll be too weak to fight if zombies appear.

It's fake, right? Even though the details are very realistic, the content is just too exaggerated. The government cannot possibly turn 80% of people into zombies. That's nonsense. I've never believed in such stuff. How could there be zombies in the world? We should trust science; none of this unscientific stuff.

question: #question#Li Yang is very confident about his rational understanding. What will he do?

content.content: The government can't turn 80% of people into zombies. That's ridiculous. Even if there are zombies, with my strong physique, I can take down three at a time. Bring on the zombies! I'll take care of them. I'm a natural zombie slayer, hahaha. Let them come, I'll handle them.
Bombs? That's just fear-mongering. A bomb can't kill me. If they dare to use bombs, it'll only be the zombies that die.
I've never seen any zombies. This kind of thing can't happen to me. This message must be fake, right?

dialog.content: (Going to check) It's so quiet here. Can we have some music?
Are you joking?
Is it not funny?
But honestly, I could fulfill your request.
No, I think I just saw something strange.
It's time to take a look at this crazy world!
Is someone over there... eating people?
What do you want to do? Do you want to go have a look?

content.content: Stay calm, Li Yang. You were in the special forces, you know you must remain calm and rational now. First, find some weapons and supplies, then make an escape plan.

question: #question# How does Li Yang regulate his fear and stress after encountering zombies?

content.content: This must be a hallucination, looks like I need a drink to sober up. Life is already like this, who cares about zombies. I just took a sneak peek, those zombies are really terrifying, I never thought such creatures would exist in the real world. I'll have a drink; if I die, let it be as a drunkard to ease my pain.

I don't care about zombies, I have nothing to lose anyway, what is there to fear, I'm not afraid at all. Aaaaah, I'm crying, I'm really scared, why would zombies appear in the real world, that's anti-science, how could such a metaphysical thing happen, who on earth invented the zombie virus?
This must be because I drank too much alcohol and am hallucinating. Zombies? It's definitely because of drinking too much.

I must stay calm and not let fear control me. As a former special forces soldier, I have the ability to handle dangerous situations. Rational actions are needed now, go downstairs first to see what's really happening. If it's really zombies, I need to use my skills to protect myself and others.

question: #question# How can Li Yang express that he has the ability to maintain a positive attitude in difficult situations?

content.content: These people are too crazy! I'm going down to teach them a lesson, whether they're zombies or not, I don't fear them! Come on, zombie punks, bring it on, grandpa's here to deal with you! Who's scared? I'm an ex-special forces soldier.
Whatever, I'm in this situation already, just go with the flow and see what happens. I really don't care anymore.
This can't be real, how could zombies appear? Go down and confirm it, this must be some kind of prank or farce.

dialog.content: (seeing the zombie) No way, this really is real!
Danger, danger, get away quickly!
I’ve never seen a zombie before, I need to take a good look!
Warning you again, otherwise face the consequences.
(takes out phone) Hold on, let me take a photo before I go.

This is not acting, nor a dream. Li Yang prepares to take a commemorative photo, and the zombie notices him, screaming and rushing towards him quickly. It’s unclear whether the zombie’s mutated strength is overwhelming or if Li Yang’s years of heavy drinking have severely weakened his physical condition, but Li Yang unexpectedly fails to control it. He gets bitten and turns into a zombie.
(discovers zombies) Oh my, this looks like it's for real!
Danger, danger, leave quickly.
I've never seen a zombie before, I’ve got to take a good look!
This is a warning again, proceed at your own risk.
(takes out phone) Hold on, let me snap a picture before I go.

This wasn't acting, nor was it a dream. Li Yang prepared to take a commemorative photo, but the zombie also noticed Li Yang and charged at him with a screech. Whether it's the mutated strength of the zombie or the fact that Li Yang's physical condition has worsened due to years of heavy drinking, Li Yang couldn't manage to fend it off. He was bitten and turned into a zombie himself.
Think twice before acting!
Why should I be scared when I'm this strong? Knowing there are tigers in the mountains, yet heading towards them anyway!
You bear the consequences!
Got it, whether you die early or late, it's all the same! Here I go~

Li Yang ignored the warning and swaggered out the door. As soon as he stepped out, he saw zombies wandering the hallway. Mistaking them for regular neighbors and letting his guard down, he was unfortunately surrounded and turned into a zombie himself.

profile.name: Zombie Aunt Wang
profile.goal: Doesn't want to hurt people, wants to warn normal humans to stay away.

dialog.content: No... no...
What?
Stay back!
Aunt Wang, what's wrong?
I... I'm mutating.
What?
Go quickly, I'm going to turn into a zombie... ah ah ah, I can't control myself, you have to go. I don't want to hurt more people or make more zombies. I absolutely refuse to succumb to this virus.
A zombie is attacking you, what do you do?

content.content: Oh man, you're about to mutate, sorry Aunt Wang. Once you mutate, you won't be conscious. You're no longer Aunt Wang now. Watch out, I'm a former special forces soldier. Zombies, get ready to see how awesome I am today!

question: #question# How can Li Yang show that he's really confident in his abilities?

content.content: Zombies are usually pretty weak, should be easy to handle.

The weather's nice today, perfect for killing zombies. But I can't, it's Aunt Wang. Aunt Wang, don't blame me. You know the best way to not hurt others is to kill you before you fully mutate. Don't hold it against me, I'm going to help you fulfill your own wish.

Maybe, possibly, I could take her out, let's give it a shot. No way, it's Aunt Wang. She's worked so hard to warn us to leave. If I kill her now, am I even human? She still has a tiny bit of consciousness left.

Aunt Wang, you're putting me in a tough spot. You're on the verge of mutating, neither fully human nor fully zombie. It's hard for me to take action. If I do, it's a moral burden. If I don't, there's a risk to my life. This is too much. I think I'll head home first, grab some weapons, and then see how to handle the situation.

question: #question# How can Li Yang make a well-considered decision?

content.content: (internally conflicted) Aunt Wang, you're not just my neighbor, but someone who watched me grow up like family. Now that you're infected, if you fully turn into a zombie, can I really do it? I should go home first and ask my family what they think. I need time, I need to think, I need to make a decision I won't regret.

You're about to mutate, but how can I act against a living person? Oh, Aunt Wang, you're causing quite the problem. I think I'll go back and grab some weapons first, and then assess the situation. There's no particularly good option right now, so let's go with this for now. But you're definitely doomed. First, I'll run away, and next time we meet, I'll have a legitimate reason to take you out.

Aunt Wang, you have to die, no matter what, no matter what you've just said. I know you mean well, not wanting to hurt those around you, but you have to die. Only then can those around survive. But I might not be able to beat you. In the past, I could have taken on ten of you.

dialog.content: The zombies are coming!
It’s just a living dead, isn’t it? I’m not afraid of the living, so why would I be afraid of a dead person like you?
Friendly reminder: The opponent is powerful, please stay safe.
Don’t worry, I’m a tough guy, I can handle this!

Li Yang decided to take down the zombie. Unarmed, he launched a series of punches at it. However, the zombie felt no pain. Although Li Yang was a retired soldier and hadn’t forgotten the skills he learned, his health had deteriorated significantly due to excessive drinking and irregular routines. The next second, he was pounced on and devoured by the zombie. Li Yang ultimately died from his reckless overconfidence.
What am I supposed to grab?
You can look around the house for a usable weapon.
This rundown place hardly has any weapons; just this folding knife.
Use your ingenuity to create something!
Oh right, I can combine the nails with this wooden stick and see who dares to come close!
Quick, use your new weapon~

content.content: Let's choose this folding knife, it's small but incredibly agile. No matter who it is, if they get close, I'll leave them in shreds.

question: #question# How will Li Yang, who has always relied on himself, act now that he's like a startled bird?

content.content: On TV, they always use such sharp knives for killing zombies, it's super quick, let's go with this.
The old squad leader always said, use knives for close combat, and following his advice now can't be wrong.
Call the government department and ask which weapon is efficient.

(Familiarized with the nail stick and practiced several combat moves) This nail stick is newly made, but its basic usage can still be combined with previous experience. Plus, it's got a decent reach, useful for both defense and offense, so I'll go with it.

question: #question# How should Li Yang express that he has adapted to and is using a new tool?

content.content: This thing should be pretty powerful, let's go with it. But I'm not exactly proficient in using it, let me think, how does this work, how does this kill, oh man.

It's different from the weapons I've used before, but it shouldn't be ineffective. Maybe in a real battle against the undead, I'll figure it out, but for now, better make a run for it rather than overthink.
Both the knife and the nail stick are pretty handy; the newer it is, the sharper it becomes. The nail stick is newly crafted, let's use this.

dialog.content: Are you sure such a small knife is okay?
I think it's fine.
I have doubts...
I don’t care what you think, I care what I think.
Alright then.

Li Yang decided to take down the zombie with a folding knife. He forcefully stabbed towards the zombie's temple, but the sharp little knife lodged itself into the zombie's head at an angle. Due to the close distance, the zombie lunged forward and grabbed Li Yang. Unable to pull out the knife in time, Li Yang was bitten by the zombie and turned into one himself.
(after chopping down a few zombies) Wow, this thing is actually pretty handy.
Congratulations, you've unlocked a new tool usage.
Looks like I'm still in fine form!
Why not give it another try~
How should I try it out?
There's a small group of zombies ahead. Will you confront them directly or take the side path to avoid them?

content.content: Given the chaotic situation, surviving is my main goal, not taking out more zombies. Let's take the side path.

question: #question# Li Yang knows his main goal is to escape, not to kill more zombies. What will he do?

content.content: The side path seems deserted and safer by comparison. Let's go this way.
A bunch of zombies probably can't squeeze into this path, so let's take the side route.
I'll just toss a coin and choose whatever.
Taking the side path means a detour and more time spent, while charging down the main road gets me to the rendezvous point quicker. Just a few zombies should be easy to handle.

question: #question# How can Li Yang demonstrate his strong sense of time management?

content.content: Having just taken out a few zombies, let's strike while the iron is hot and take care of a few more. I'll choose this path with zombies.
With my extensive combat experience, these few zombies are no match for me. Let's go down the main road and show them what I'm made of.
The main road might take 10 minutes, the side path 5 minutes, but running from zombies on the main road could get me there in 3 minutes. So I'll take the main road.

dialog.content: (Li Yang arrives in front of a shop. He often comes here to eat noodles. The shop is run by an elderly couple who are very kind.) Huh, there are two zombies clawing at the door. Well, unlucky for you guys, you've run into me today. (Li Yang draws his weapon and swiftly takes care of the two zombies.) Hey, is there anyone inside? I've dealt with the zombies outside, it's safe now.

profile.name: Boss Wang
profile.public profile: Owner of a noodle shop, kind and loving.

dialog.content: Finally seeing a living person, you must have been terrified, right?
Absolutely, it was terrifying.
I'm starving right now, can you make me a bowl of noodles?

Of course. (After making the noodles, he watches Li Yang eat heartily and relaxes a bit.) Thank you, otherwise I might have been a goner. You're heading to the meeting point, right? Would you mind taking me with you? Having company on the road would be great, and I could be of help to you.

content.content: (Seeing the minimal food left in the shop, he thinks there might be situations on the run where he can't find food, so preparing food in advance is necessary to escape successfully. There's not enough food for three people, so it's better to just grab their food and run first.) Sorry, but in this world, food is the most important thing to survive. I have to take the food and escape.

question: #question# To increase the success rate of escaping, Li Yang suddenly has a new idea, but it's not very humane. What is it?

content.content: (With obvious hesitation and uncertainty in his tone) Food is indeed very important, without it, we might starve. But... I'm not sure if taking their food is the best solution. I think there might be other ways to solve this problem, but I don't have any good ideas right now. However, the noodles are really tasty, so I'll think about it.

Food is the most important, there's no choice. We don't have enough food, so let's take what we can. It might not be right, but I don't have any other options. Let's escape first and deal with it later. There must be some delicious noodles at the meeting point, I really want to taste those.

A helper is very important, especially one who can make noodles. This world is cruel, and you can only rely on yourself to survive. No need to hesitate, I'll just take their food so I can live. Everyone has to think for themselves, I don't have time to worry about too much.

(Internally struggling, feeling unbearable seeing the familiar boss but managed to hold back) I would really like to take you with me, but I can't even ensure my own safety. I might end up being eaten by zombies once I get out there. I really can't shoulder such an important responsibility.

question: #question# How does Li Yang express that he is controlling his impulse to act on good intentions?

content.content: You don't need to take the risk with me. You have a skill, and it's relatively safe here for now. The most important thing is that you're not strong enough to defend yourself, and heading out will surely get you killed. The zombies likely won't come here soon, and if they do, they will probably be hungry too – you can make noodles for them. Right?

Your mind works fast, you should know that following me isn't guaranteed survival, because I'm usually quite selfish and might only look after myself. If we encounter danger, you're as good as dead, better to stay here and make some money with your noodles.

Let's go together, but although we're acquaintances, let's be clear that if we're both in danger, I won't sacrifice myself to save you. So don't hold any grudges then. Sigh, let's go, let's go, I really can't handle you.
In this situation, staying here alone is not an option. Two people have a better chance of survival than one, and we can help each other out and escape together.

question: #question# How does Li Yang express that he wants to collaborate with others to achieve a goal?

content.content: Forget it, I'm full, I'm leaving.
(This old man is quite plump, might as well pretend to agree and push him out to the zombies if needed.) Alright, boss, let's go together.
Great, boss, take the noodles with you. On the road, we'll not only have food for energy but also use your noodles to fight zombies.

dialog.content: What are you doing?
Trying to stay alive.
Put it down, then I'll let you go.
No way, what I see is mine.
Either put it down, or don't even think about leaving!
Sorry about this... (prepares to leave)

Li Yang decided to snatch the remaining food. To survive in this post-apocalyptic world, food is essential. A struggle ensued between Li Yang and the Boss. The Boss was no match for Li Yang, and he managed to seize the food, preparing to leave. Just as Li Yang was about to step out the door, the Boss let out a loud yell and drove a knife deep into Li Yang's body. The stab was deep, and Li Yang regretted not eliminating the threat completely. In the end, Li Yang died from massive hemorrhaging due to a pierced heart.
I understand you, things are pretty chaotic right now.
I’m really sorry!
No worries, good luck to you.
Good luck to you too, hope you get out soon.
While you still have the chance, you should hurry up and go!
See you at the evacuation point!

Li Yang decided to escape alone. At night, a famished Li Yang arrived at a supermarket, intending to find something to eat, but was ambushed by a group of zombies hiding in the corner. Exhausted and overpowered, Li Yang was torn apart by the zombies.
That's great, I was most afraid of being a burden to you.
Not at all, why would it be! You're about the same age as my parents, and all children wish their parents well.
Yes, and we wish for our children to be well too.
So I'm sure your children would want me to take you along. I also hope my parents can meet kind-hearted people.
They surely will.
There's a place up ahead, it's getting late. Let's go in and rest for now.
It's dangerous outside; have you thought it through? Do you really want to be the good person and carry this burden?

content.content: If I'm alone, I might still have the energy to manage well, but having two people with me on the road is somewhat taxing. At this rate, I might not even reach the destination before dying. It's better to leave him and move on alone.

question: #question# How can Li Yang express that he is reallocating his current energy to improve efficiency for his survival goal?

content.content: This old man doesn’t help me with anything on the road. I feel he's useless, so I’d rather be free on my own.
I like being a lone wolf; it's better to go solo.
Being alone is more convenient for both me and him. He probably thinks so too. Let's just go our separate ways.
(internally struggling) In such a chaotic world, what's the chance for an unarmed person to survive? If I abandon them, I'd be less than human.

question: #question# How can Li Yang demonstrate that he possesses higher ethical and moral capabilities?

content.content: He's just an old man, but he can serve as a meat shield. It's a win-win deal.
The boss can cook, so he can make me meals. He has some use; let's stick together for now.
In a world full of zombies, having someone with me is already an advantage.

dialog.content: (mumbling in sleep) Alright, alright, I'm getting up.
I'm really sorry, I didn't mean to, but given the situation now...
(mumbling in sleep) Hehe, don't worry.
Never mind, I'll leave the food for you. Best of luck to you all.

Li Yang decided to sneak away at dawn. He then went to a supermarket to find some food but was ambushed by a group of zombies hidden in the corner. Exhausted and outnumbered, Li Yang was overwhelmed and devoured by the zombies.

(As the sun rises, the two of them freshen up and set off. Just as they step outside, they notice the doors of the daycare beside the inn are open. At that moment, a woman with delicate features rushes out, looking quite astonished to see a living person here.) Hello.

profile.name: Teacher Zhou
profile.goal: To ensure the safety of the children.

dialog.content: Help! Please save the children in the daycare. A zombie got in.
(Rushes into the daycare and quickly deals with the zombie) Don't be scared, kids. You're safe now.
(Shaken) Thank you, thank you. Who are you?
I'm Li Yang. It's not safe here. We should take the first chance to leave.
I want to leave too, but with so many kids, it’s really tough. Can you help us? Can we go with you?
(Thinking of his children) Alright, let’s go together.
Thank you, thank you so much. There’s some food left in the kitchen. We can take it with us to eat on the way.
Let’s hurry. (Scouts outside and finds a school bus) Can this bus be driven?
Yes, but none of us can drive. Can you?
We both can. (Sees them grabbing the food) While there aren’t any zombies outside, get on the bus quickly. (Helps the children onto the bus)

(Hears a howling sound, sees a man surrounded by zombies in the distance) That seems to be our vice principal. He went out yesterday and hasn’t returned. What should we do, Li Yang? Can you save him? (The group of kids all start pleading with Li Yang to rescue him)

content.content: The situation doesn’t look too bad. It’s still possible to rescue him. Boss Wang, you start the bus and try to lure away some zombies, then attempt to shake them off. Teacher Zhou, hide with the kids. I’ll handle the remaining ones. We’ll split up and act quickly.

question: #question# How can Li Yang harness everyone's strength to get the man out as quickly as possible?

content.content: If you want to save him, you go ahead and save him yourself. The man is already surrounded by zombies. Even if you kill them, he might still mutate. Do you expect Boss Wang to cook for the zombies, Teacher Zhou to teach them, and me to coach them in sports after he changes?
Everyone, think about what you can do to help so we can rescue him together.
There are only a few zombies. Let’s scare them off together.
There are too many zombies. Going now won’t help him, and you’ll all be in danger.

question: #question# How can Li Yang persuade them not to save the vice principal themselves?

content.content: I don't like the way that guy looks, so I don't want to save him.

You all want me to save him, but I won’t. Besides, going now would be a death wish. The zombies have already gotten to him, and even if we saved him, he’d mutate and we’d end up killing him anyway. It’s best not to save him at all.
The vice principal must have his reasons for going out. He must not want to come back, so there’s no point in saving him.

dialog.content: Kids, follow me.
I’m going. Be careful.

Alright. (Boss Wang drives and quickly hits a zombie, three zombies chase the car, while the remaining two are taken by surprise from behind by Li Yang and are successfully neutralized. He saves a man defending himself with a stick.) It’s alright now, you're not hurt, are you? Follow me quickly.

profile.name: Vice Principal Zhang
profile.public profile: Assistant Principal of a tutorial school, rich second generation, lack of experience.

dialog.content: Thank you so much, I almost lost my life. You arrived just in time!
(Takes him to a safe place) No problem, I'm Li Yang. (To Teacher Zhou) Is Boss Wang back?
I’m back, I lost those zombies.
Great, let's go quickly. (Everyone sets off together and, after a long walk, they take a brief rest. While Li Yang goes to relieve himself, Vice Principal Zhang takes out a bank card.)
With so many people, the chances of survival are low. There's 2 million in this card. If you take me alone to the meeting point, all the money is yours. How about it?

content.content: (Li Yang looks at the bank card in his hand, remembering the tough times after his wife and daughter left. The money could help him live well, and he is very tempted.) Alright, I really do need the money. But be discreet, don’t let anyone find out.

question: #question# How can Li Yang express his genuine need for money?

content.content: You’re coming to me with a request, so I agreed, but it's not just because of the money. Little did I expect, in these zombie-infested times where everyone fears for their lives, money is still all-powerful. Haha, this is unbelievable.
2 million is a bit low, but close enough for me.

Are you stupid? Don’t try to negotiate with me. Having money but no life to spend it is the same as having no money at all. Still, you’re trying to negotiate. Next time zombies attack, do you believe I’ll let you die? You have a bank card, just hand it over to me. It’s what you should do, not your bargaining chip. Do you understand the situation?
(Inside, he finds this behavior very offensive and infuriating, feeling disrespected) What do you take me for? I’m not taking it. Given that we need people now, I'll pretend this didn't happen.

Vice Principal Zhang thinks Li Yang is refusing a toast only to drink a forfeit, so late at night, he steals Li Yang's weapon and everyone’s food, drives off in the car, and escapes alone. With no logistical support, Li Yang’s team doesn’t last long in the next zombie encounter and is wiped out.
Due to the large number of people, the moving target becomes too big and they are eventually discovered, turning them into a sumptuous meal for zombies.

Although Li Yang refused, Boss Wang secretly accepted Vice Principal Zhang’s proposal. The two drive off with everything in the dead of night, leaving the others struggling to survive. Most of them become zombie food.

question: #question# How can Li Yang control his anger after feeling his dignity was offended by this proposal?

content.content: Forget it, I don’t want your filthy money. We saved you just for you to turn on us? You should know, at first I wasn’t going to save you; it was those teachers and students who begged me for a long time. (With that, he angrily kicks the vice principal to the ground) Didn’t expect we'd save someone so ungrateful as you. Just die already, next time I absolutely won’t save you.
Too little, at least 5 million. In the zombie era, money’s useless if you die. 2 million is not enough, have 5 million ready before you negotiate with me, or don’t bother.
There are more bank cards at the meeting point, I don’t want your card.

dialog.content: Don't worry, it's definitely easier for the two of us to escape than just one.
Let's hope so.
(after crossing a few blocks) Why did we suddenly run into zombies!
It's just a few zombies, nothing to worry about.
Yeah, that's what I got you for.
Stand back, I'll take care of them.

Already exhausted, Li Yang struggles against the zombies but gradually gets overwhelmed. He quickly runs off. Vice Principal Zhang drives away, looking at the zombies chasing them. Li Yang curses loudly, but it’s all in vain, and he gets devoured by the horde of zombies behind him.
Alright
Even so, you can still escape with us.
Really? That's great.
(walking out from the corner) Hearing your conversation, I once again believe, Li Yang, that you're a good leader.
You're flattering me.
Such a loud noise, sounds like a helicopter.
Seems like it's a military helicopter, the government is here to rescue us.

The sound of helicopter rotors came from above, then a ladder was lowered down. The zombies surrounding the building were shot in the head. Li Yang looked up and saw it was a military helicopter. Everyone hurriedly climbed up one by one, and the helicopter took them to the evacuation point. The military officer was shocked to learn that Li Yang had escaped with so many people. After conducting a checkup, they had escorts take everyone away. Later, major newspapers interviewed Li Yang, hailing him as a true hero. Due to the disaster, Li Yang's family had all perished, so everyone decided to form a family, and in this crisis, love sparked between Li Yang and Teacher Zhou. Li Yang proposed to Teacher Zhou. Boss Wang's stocks he purchased when he was young earned a huge profit. Li Yang had a happy and fulfilling family.
Yeah, let's hurry and go.

(As night quickly fell, Li Yang found a safe place to rest. At dawn, he encountered a group of zombies on the road. Li Yang tripped over a protruding stone and twisted his left ankle. The zombies, hearing the noise, began to gather) Ouch!
How is it? Can you still walk?
Try to stand up!

(He tried and failed) No, it's no use. There's no way I can keep up with this injury. You all go on without me. I'll be the decoy and buy you some time. (Li Yang decided to sacrifice himself to let everyone else escape. After spending days together, they had formed bonds, so everyone wept. Boss Wang calmly led everyone away. Li Yang made noise to attract the zombies, giving the others time to retreat, and heroically sacrificed himself.)

Li Yang charged towards the zombies, full of confidence, not anticipating the tremendous strength of these zombies' attacks. He quickly lost the upper hand, and as he considered fleeing, more zombies gathered around him. In despair, Li Yang became a meal for the zombies.
